skillTree.localised_description: A mighty beast wracked by corrosion and decay, taller than a man and possessed of a crushing mass, this rotting creation of the Urfather is the personal mount of Valnir.
The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
The followers of Chaos need not to rest, they march on with iron hearts desperate to harvest souls.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
Thusly, the virulent maladies of the Crow are borne forth to repulse and infect its mortal foes; there lieth victory eternal.
This fetid, disgusting pus is so repulsive to the untainted that it mimics traditional armour of far greater substance.
"My bedfellows are pestilence, famine and war… but mainly pestilence."

effects.description:
Growth per region: +5 after winning a battle
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Valnir's blows do not only kill, they consume the souls of his victims as well. Much of this stolen energy is passed to Lord Nurgle, but it also strengthens Valnir, making him stronger and faster in his task of collecting souls.
As their brains become infested with worms and a burning fewer, the victims become insane and weak-willed.
The flesh of the victims of the Black Rot turns dark, their hair falls out and their skin becomes a leprous, putrefied mess.
The horrifying disease of the north wipes out men like a scythe cuts wheat.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

skillTree.localised_description: His body has been crushed in battle many times, yet he has always risen again, ever eager to slay more and leave their rotting carcasses empty of their essence, their souls sent screaming to the realm of Nurgle.

ui_effects.localised_text: Chance of unit gaining hit points

skillTree.localised_description: Valnir is surrounded by the sickly stench of death and a cloud of carrion flies hovers around him wherever he goes, flies that bite and claw at any who sense his presence. For with Valnir hunting, death and decay is inevitable.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Imagine a rubbery, pus-filled bag lurching towards you. Now imagine it is travelling at twice its usual speed...

skillTree.localised_description: Sensible enemies think at least twice before attacking such a diseased specimen, for even if they win, chances are they have caught something really nasty along the way.

skillTree.localised_description: Grandfather loves the smallest of his many children at least as much as his myriad other grim creations, if not more so.

skillTree.localised_description: The flying things are beloved of Nurgle, for they are, oft-times, the method of infection for his most potent, hideous infirmities.

skillTree.localised_description: Sickness so vile that it strikes as true and as hard as the perfect sword-blow.

skillTree.localised_description: The air most creatures breathe provides just another avenue of attack for Nurgle and his many and varied contagions.

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption – as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Just as all life is born, so it must wither and die. Before that happens comes disease, in all its disgusting, filth-ridden glory.
Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those corrupted by Nurgle's rot flock to his putrid banner in the hope that they will be reborn anew in Grandfather's image.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Cycle time: -1 for Basic Military buildings
	(factionwide)

Recruitment health: +25% for Forsaken, Plaguebearer and Exalted Plaguebearer units
	(all armies)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Only Valnir and his patron know how many souls he must gather before he can rest again. In the passage of time Valnir has come to hate all living beings because they stubbornly hold onto their souls and do not surrender them to his lord Nurglc. His flesh has rotted almost completely away. His Chaos armour is a shattered ruin. Maggots writhe in his eye sockets. His entrails ooze through the gaps in his armour. Yet a terrifying strength lives on in his skeletal frame. His grip is like iron, and no foe struck by his terrible flail ever recovers. The more he slays, the greater his vitality grows. His body has been crushed in battle many times, yet he has always risen again, ever eager to slay more and leave their rotting carcasses empty of their essence, their souls sent screaming to the realm of Nurgle.

effects.description:
Chance of a plague spreading: +15%
	(Lord's army)

Enemy leadership: -8
	(enemy armies in local province)
